address: Thị trấn An Lão, Huyện An Lão, Tỉnh Bình Định
thought:
**Finding the New Administrative Unit for "Thị trấn An Lão, Huyện An Lão, Tỉnh Bình Định"**

Okay, here's my thought process. The user wants the new administrative unit for that old address. First things first, I need to identify the old province: Bình Định.  I know I need to check for province mergers, specifically Resolution 60-NQ/TW. Ah, there it is! "Tỉnh Bình Định" merged into "Tỉnh Gia Lai".  So the province is now Gia Lai.

Next, I have to pinpoint the old ward, which is "Thị trấn An Lão". Now I'm hunting through other resolutions, looking for "Thị trấn An Lão" in the context of either Bình Định (the old province) or Gia Lai (the new one). Bingo! Resolution 1664/NQ-UBTVQH15, concerning administrative adjustments in Gia Lai, has a perfect match. Item 38 states that "Thị trấn An Lão" combined with An Tân and An Hưng, forms a new ward also called "Xã An Lão".

I've got a new ward name! Now, I need to verify this against a list of new wards. I cross-reference the new name and find that it indeed corresponds to "Xã An Lão" within "Tỉnh Gia Lai," confirmed by the ward code "21609".

Therefore, I'm confident in my findings. The output will be: the new province is Gia Lai, the new ward is Xã An Lão, the ward code is 21609, and the supporting citation is Resolution 1664/NQ-UBTVQH15, specifically item 38. The confidence is very high since the old ward is specifically mentioned in the province resolution, which is relevant for the changed province. I will then double-check other resolutions and make sure there isn't any other possibility with the given old address. I will ignore other resolutions that mention the same old address but in different provinces.

citation.header: 1664/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Gia Lai
citation.line: 38. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của thị trấn An Lão, xã An Tân và xã An Hưng thành xã mới có tên gọi là **xã An Lão**.
